column2: Goldman Sachs sued in Singapore penny stock saga SINGAPORE
column3: Nov 30 A shareholder who suffered losses in a penny stock trading debacle in Singapore is suing Goldman Sachs
column4: accusing the investment bank of arbitrarily selling her holdings and saying the sales contributed to a crash in their prices.

column2: Five insurers in final round for Citi's Asia bank distribution deal HONG KONG
column3: Nov 29 Five insurers including Metlife Inc and Manulife Financial Corp have submitted final bids to have their products distributed by Citigroup in Asia
column4: a deal estimated to generate more than $10 billion in revenue over 15 years
column5: people familiar with the matter told Reuters.

column3: ' 'Frozen' heat up Thanksgiving film box office LOS ANGELES
column4: Nov 29 Action film "The Hunger Games: Catching Fire" led the North American box office with ticket sales of $35.6 million over the first two days of the long U.S. Thanksgiving weekend that began on Wednesday

WMT,UPDATE 2-Fights, store evacuation mar U.S. holiday shopping rush Nov 29 The post-Thanksgiving shopping rush sparked incidents of violence across the United States as a police officer was injured breaking up a fight, a shopper was shot in the leg over a TV and a Walmart was evacuated, according to police and media reports.
